intro: Homilacanthus gregorii, commonly known as the Gregor's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. Homilacanthus gregorii is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
